title: [IOTDB-5512] Fixed IoTConsensus may repeatedly send some log when restarting
body:
## Description


### The persistence of log synchronization is not timely, resulting in repeated sending of logs when restarting

Solution: Extend the persistence strategy of log synchronization

Please see details in [IOTDB-5112](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5512) and [feishu cloud doc](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/DddIdK9bnojYbsxQHFbcmkx7nKc)

title: Fix some broken links in README
Fix typo
[IOTDB-5112] Fixed IoTConsensus synchronization stuck under low load or during restart
body:
## Description


### The log synchronization logic of the receiving end of IoTConsensus is judged by nextSyncIndex, which may cause a 10-second delay when the iotdb is initially started and under low load.

Solution: Set the nextSyncIndex when timeout.


Please see details in [IOTDB-5112](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5112) and [feishu cloud doc](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/TekkdtRvTo181UxI2x0c42iTnsN).

title: [IOTDB-4005] Optimize the pipeline build logic for consumeAllNode
body:
This pull request optimize the pipeline build logic for consumeAllNode like following:
1. When dop > localChildrenSize, create one new pipeline for each local child, which is not including ExchangeNode. And offer extra dop for childNode.
2. When dop <= localChildrenSize, divide local children into dop groups. These groups may include ExchangeNode but the dop for child is 1, which can avoid the situation that generate child iteratively.

title: [IOTDB-5509] Add level control for cross compaction selecting
body:
**Description**

In this change, we add a limitation for cross compaction selector to increase the compaction efficiency. That is, only the unseqFile whose level larger that 0 can be selected as the candidate of cross compaction.

So, the small unseq file will be compacted inner before doing cross space compaction

title: [IOTDB-5526] Fix NPE while construct timeseries black list in SchemaRegion
body:
## Description

When constructing timeseries black list in SchemaRegion, there won't be any schema template provided, which brings npe when trying to get child node from template. Add judgement before getting child node will fix this.

title: [IOTDB-5517] Add metrics for disk io
body: See [IOTDB-5517](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5517). # Overview This PR add metrics for disk i/o and process i/o status. When IoTDB runs in different os, the way to monitor the i/o status is different. **Currently only disk i/o monitor in Linux is implemented, monitor in Windows and MacOS may be implemented later.** # Metrics For disk i/o, now monitor traces the following metrics. ## Disk IO Busy Rate ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218907109-a63a0244-fe8f-4697-b5b3-1718877dbe3d.png) ### What It Means This metric indicates how busy the disk I/O is, which represents how much time per second the disk is engaged in I/O. **But according to this [blog](https://bean-li.github.io/dive-into-iostat/), this metric can be misleading in some cases.** But here we still use this metric to give a rough indication of how busy the disk is. ### How To Get This Metric _/proc/diskstats_ stores some running information of the disk, in which _io_ticks_ is a field that indicates how much time is used the running disk i/o. We calculate the percentage of disk I/O time based on the amount of change in this value over a given period of time, divided by the total length of that period. ## Disk IO Rate ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218909041-d13d7708-ebd6-487b-81a1-721c590ab4e3.png) ### What It Means This metric indicates the disk I/O rate, and we trace the read rate and write rate for each disk separately. ### How To Get This Metric Field _rd_sectors_ and _wr_sectors_ in _/proc/diskstats_ mean the number of sectors that the disk reads or writes. The size of each sector in the disk is 512 bytes, we calculate the i/o rate by multiplying the amount of change in this value by 512 bytes. ## Disk IOPS ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218909757-ac232923-f9b8-4fce-8139-b63c06cf6ea7.png) ### What It Means This metric indicates how many disk i/o command is executed in per second. For HDD, the maximum iops is about 100-200. For SSD, the maximum iops is about 10000-20000. ### How To GetThis Metric Field _rd_ios_ and _wr_ios_ mean the number of read or write operation executed. We calculate the iops by the change of these value. ## Disk IO Time ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218914369-f29bcf0a-380b-4c52-a136-92f9d0470a9a.png) ### What It Means This metric indicates how much time all read or write operations take. Because it includes the time that the i/o request is waitting in the queue, so the value of it may be greater than 1s. ### How To Get It Field _rd_ticks_ and _wr_ticks_ have the same meaning of this metric. ## Disk IO Time For Each Op ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218914718-d30b4433-a383-485f-966b-1b04270010c6.png) ### What It Means This metric indicates how much time a read or write operation takes on average, aka the latency of an io operation. ### How To Get It We get it by the total waiting time over the operation counts. ## Disk IO Size ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218915043-75a2478b-b28e-4eee-82d6-ae90dafead21.png) ### What It Means This metric indicates the average size of an i/o operation. ### How To Get It We get it by the total i/o size over the operation counts. ## Process I/O System Call ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218915206-a4febf5d-4be8-4e65-8ef3-8e9cd207ed6d.png) ### What It Means This metrics indicates the rate that the process calls the read system call or write system call. ### How To Get It _/proc/[PID]/io_ stores some information of process i/o status, in which field _syscr_ and _syscw_ mean the calling count of read/write system call. ## Process IO Rate ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/218916195-9a639a5f-8fe0-485d-8580-3c9fd20c53f1.png) ### What It Means This metrics indicates the i/o rate of the process. ## How To Get It The field _rchar_ and _wchar_ mean the data size that the process has caused to read or write. The field _read_bytes_ and _write_bytes_ mean the data size that the process attempt to read or write.

[IOTDB-5528] Refactor schema engine and region statistics
body: ## Description The memory statistics for the current metadata are global. For better monitoring, the granularity of memory statistics needs to be refined per SchemaRegion. See https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/HD2hdIYS6oBSzsxpFw2cCNPFnoe for detail

title: Update nifi doc
[IOTDB-5474] Refactor DataNodeSchemaCache Structure
body:
## Description


### Motivation

The flattened cache structure, full path -> schema cache entry, is not efficient enough in terms of memory usage and request execution when encountering most iot scenarios, requests organized as device -> measurement -> data.

### Design

https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/Ruz7d7wacoEVuRx9vnxcFeOxn0f

### Implementation

Implement ```DualKeyCache```, which support structure like, k1->k2->value. 

Refactor the Implementation of DataNodeSchemaCache based on ```DualKeyCache```.

### Test Results

1C1D, 8G memory

#### BM Test

bm config: 500 device; 1000 sensor/device; insertRecords; batch size 1; loop 50
before this pr: 20w points/s
this pr: 34w points/s

#### InsertRecords Scenario Simulation Test

 15000 device; 40 sensor/device

master: 110w lines/minute; 0.78 cache hit rate
this pr: 140w lines/minute; 0.98 cache hit rate

title: [IOTDB-5189][IOTDB-5529]Optimize the memory usage and execution of fast compaction
body: In the past, all the chunks that overlap with the current chunk were read into the memory at one time, but now only the chunks that need to be used are read into the memory. For example: in the figure below, first read 1 into the memory, and then read 2 3 4 in sequence. At most two chunks can be stored in the memory at the same time instead of 4 chunks.

title: [To rel/1.0][IOTDB-5505] Bump Ratis version to latest 2.4.2-snapshotSnapshot
body: cherry-pick of https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/9027

title: [IOTDB-4005] Add degree of parallelism to pipeline engine
body:
In #8432 , I implemented pipeline engine to execture fragmentInstance in parallel. However, it divides pipeline by the unit of series simply. When the number of series grows, the number of pipelines grows too, which is not our expectation.
Therefore, I will add degree of parallelism to pipeline engine in this pr, which decides how many pipelines will be divided for one fragmentInstance. By this, even if the number of series is very large, we can limit the number of pipeline well.

The reason for this bug is that integer overflow occurs when casting long to integer in `executeCompaction`.

body:
See [IOTDB-5470](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5470).

The original way of collecting compaction tasks metrics is too complicated, which easily leads to errors. This PR refactored CompactionMetrics to use statistics in a similar way to FileMetrics.

title: [IOTDB-5488] Fix set system to readonly on local
body: Add local methods back.

title: [IOTDB-5480] IoTConsensus sync lag may be negative under single copy
body:
## Description

#### The threads of the LogDispatcher under single copy is empty, so safeIndex and searchIndex are the same value. The order of obtaining this value is related to the traversal order of the metricEntry in the PrometheusReporter, so it may be a negative value.  
Solution: Put two get directly into a function.
Subsequent improvements: Consider adding topological order to the traversal of metricEntry.
Please see details in [IOTDB-5480](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5480).

title: [IOTDB-5510] Block and wait to create timeseries when releasing memory
body:
## Description

The current strategy when creating a time series is to simply throw a SeriesOverflowException if memory resources are running low. However, there may be background tasks on the system that are releasing memory at this time and memory resources may become available immediately.

This PR provides a mechanism to wait for a limited time when memory is low and a releasingTask is running.

body: refactor some non-read/write-related part.

title: [IOTDB-5505] Bump Ratis version to latest 2.4.2-snapshot
body:
1. Release a ratis snapshot version including latest required patches
2. Open this PR to verify CI

The Ratis snapshot version is build upon the following commit: https://github.com/apache/ratis/commit/ebba77d8057e64492dfb318b170706f4a765462d
The Ratis snapshot branch is snapshot-branch2, see https://github.com/apache/ratis/commits/snapshot-branch2

title: [ Metrics ] The repair leader distribution panel
body:
## The repair process takes up CPU time Panel and leader distribution panel


### Leadership Distribution
The reason why nodes are not limited before is that the leader distribution can be observed on the non-leader confignode. However, when there are multiple iotdb clusters in prom, the panel will display the leader distribution of all clusters, causing the cluster display to be unclear. Therefore, it is better to add instance in the attribute to limit.

Before : 
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71131924/217752586-c295e5da-2de6-4184-beea-c214c89f1cfe.png)

After:
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71131924/217752677-4dfe9006-709d-4f1f-b2ec-a87997e712a6.png)


### Other small problems

![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71131924/217706102-34f67346-c564-4c87-8c4f-2e72c3e0f5dc.png)
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71131924/217706156-8aa5f273-f7d7-4e3f-95b3-e4c0dcd64375.png)

body:
## Description


### Motivation

see [IOTDB-5499](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5499)

### Modification

Eliminate useless log in SchemaExecutionVisitor, RegionWriteExecutor and FragmentInstanceDispatcherImpl.

title: [IOTDB-5498] Fix SessionPool OOM when the numbers of devices and sessions are large
body:
## Description

In current code of sessionPool, each session has an independent ConcurrentHashMap to record the device -> endPoint informations. 
However, when SessionPool has large number of session and each session need to insert a large number of devices, the ConcurrentHashMaps will take a lot of memory, which may lead to OOM.

In this PR, each session will share the same ConcurrentHashMap to reduce the redundant device -> endPoint informations.

title: [IOTDB-5509] Add level control for cross compaction selecting
body:
## Description
In this change, we add a limitation for cross compaction selector to increase the compaction efficiency. That is, only the unseqFile whose level larger that 0 can be selected as the candidate of cross compaction.

So, the small unseq file will be compacted inner before doing cross space compaction

title: Eliminate isDefaultSchemaMemoryConfig
body:
## Description

The config ```isDefaultSchemaMemoryConfig``` was used for initiating different default schema memory allocation in cluster mode and standalone mode. Since NewIoTDB has been removed, this config becomes useless. Eliminate it.

title: [IOTDB-5496] Rename VerticallyConcatOperator as HorizontallyConcatOperator
body:
VerticallyConcatOperator is used to horizontally concatenate TsBlocks with the same timestamp column. For example,
TsBlock A is:
| Time | ColumnA |
|    1    |     1.0    |
TsBlock B is:
| Time | ColumnB |
|    1    |       2.0    |
After the VerticallyConcatOperator, the result will be:
| Time | ColumnA | ColumnB |
|    1    |       1.0    |     2.0      |

Literally, I think it's a horizontal concatenation. So I suggest rename it as HorizontallyConcatOperator.

title: [IOTDB-5495]Improve unit tests about `show devices`
body:
Related issue: [IOTDB-5495](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5495)
A bug about `show devices` while using `offset` has been found.

See more details at [IoTDB-5350](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5350)
This bug only appears in version 1.0 or earlier version. In master branch, there is no such bug.

Even so, relevant unit tests in master branch need to be improved, because it does not cover this situation.

This bug only appears in version 1.0 or earlier version. In master branch, there is no such bug. 

Relevant unit tests have also been added.

title: [CLIENT-PY]Optimize array concatenation performance
body: [CLIENT-PY]When fetching data from the server in batches, each np.concatenate() will create a new array and copy the stock array. To optimize performance, after parsing all batches of arrays, execute np.concatenate() only once.

title: [IOTDB-5477] Refactor the interaction between InsertNode and SchemaFetcher
body:
## Description


### Motivation

The schema cache read, schemaTree construction and insertNode.validateSchema repeat the process of scanning device path and measurements of input timeseries, which is redundant and can be simplified into one time process for all.

### Modification

Refer to the design of ```Map.compute```, we set the similar interfaces for schema fetcher, ```SchemaFetcher.computeSchemaWithAutoCreate```. During reading schema cache and checking the fetched schema tree, the specific validation operation provided by InsertNode will be executed without repeated scan.

### Result

When all the schema for data insertion has been cached, the time cost of schema validation nearly all focus on cache.get.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38524330/217737211-4474910e-b32c-4f69-a4c1-1c39a7b3a679.png)

title: Accelerate Count TimeSeries
body:
## Description

Currently, the time series reader is implemented based on ```ShowTimeSeriesResult```, which is used as temporary schema result carrier and costs construction time. The construction time of ```ShowTimeSeriesResult``` can be saved via a light implementation generating fewest extra temporary objects.

Count timeseries operation benefits from the modification most. Its time consumption decreased to 1/4~1/3.

title: update client version and jdbc version to 0.13.4
add release note for 0.13.4
new encoding algorithms REGER
body:
## REGER in new paper  Reordering Time Series Data for Regression Encoding


In this paper,
we propose REGER, a novel encoding algorithm that can effectively encode time series 
with large value fluctuations and spreads.
The idea is to reorder the data points in the time series, such that the consecutive ones have smoother timestamps and values.
